itemLabel: Robert Spencer, 1st Baron Spencer of Wormleighton

wikipedia_page.main: Robert Spencer, 1st Baron Spencer of Wormleighton KG (1570 – 25 October 1627) was an English nobleman, peer, politician, landowner, and MP from the Spencer family.

link_mentions.page: William Spencer, 2nd Baron Spencer of Wormleighton
response: Spencer was the son of Robert Spencer, 1st Baron Spencer of Wormleighton, and his wife, Margaret Willoughby, and was baptised on 4 January 1591 at Brington, Northamptonshire. He attended Magdalen College, Oxford, and became a Member of Parliament for Brackley in 1614, for Northamptonshire (1620–1622 & 1624–1627). From 6 May 1618 to 1621, Spencer held the office of Deputy Lieutenant of Northamptonshire. On 25 October 1627, he succeeded to the title of 2nd Baron Spencer of Wormleighton.
* Robert Spencer, 1st Baron Spencer of Wormleighton (1570–1627), English peer

#REDIRECT Robert Spencer, 1st Baron Spencer of Wormleighton

Spencer was the son of Robert Spencer, 1st Baron Spencer of Wormleighton and his wife Margaret, daughter of Sir Francis Willoughby and Elizabeth Lyttelton. He was baptised on 21 October 1593. He was educated at Corpus Christi, Oxford in 1609 and was awarded BA in 1612. History of Parliament Online - Richard Spencer His brothers were Sir Edward Spencer, Sir John Spencer, and William Spencer, 2nd Baron Spencer of Wormleighton.

Spencer was the son of Robert Spencer, 1st Baron Spencer of Wormleighton and his wife  Margaret Willoughby the daughter of Sir Francis Willoughby and Elizabeth Lyttelton. The Spencer Family Tree  He was baptised at Brington on 2 March 1594. He matriculated at Corpus Christi, Oxford on 13 November 1609, aged 14 and was awarded  BA on 18 February 1612. In 1618 he was called to the bar at Lincoln's Inn.  'Alumni Oxonienses, 1500-1714: Spackman-Stepney', Alumni Oxonienses 1500-1714 (1891), pp. 1394-1422. Date accessed: 22 May 2012
